201044.text: As a gifted alchemist, how come I was just saved by you...

201045.text: This is because I haven't done enough research...

201046.text: I will have the ultimate magic power once my research is done. I am the only chosen one.

201047.text: I'll get stronger, for I am the true heir of magic!

201051.text: Oh, you are the one Deluca mentioned before...

201053.text: Deluca speaks very highly of you. Would you lend me a hand?

201056.text: I hired her. Her research on mysterious things is an important cornerstone of restoring my family's former glory.

201057.text: You know, it's hard to find the hidden treasure merely on my own.

201058.text: Uh, that's the scroll I found in The Church's library. It documented clues to the ancient treasure.

201059.text: Rumor has it that you can find the lost magic with this scroll.

201060.text: I made a copy of it. If you find anything, please keep me posted.

201061.text: Human with silver hair, here you are...

201062.text: Well, what I know is quite limited.

201063.text: Followers like us can only be in awe of the greatness of the Chronospace Protector.

201065.text: I've been here ever since I started to follow the Protector. Never have I heard about any treasure...

201066.text: Human with silver hair, You must have a strong connection with us.

201067.text: You should also believe in the Chronospace Protector and obey her will.

201068.text: Is that so...Well, one day, you will join us.

201069.text: The more you explore the darkness, the more you will yearn for our warmth.

201070.text: One day, you will join us.

201071.text: Hey, what are you doing here?

201072.text: What? Are you afraid...Or just cautious?

201073.text: I won't hurt you. I am Fellagood from The Church, a preacher who serves the merciful God.

201074.text: Oh, I heard that some wicked ones are searching for the Sacred Relic here.

201075.text: They intend to awaken the demon in slumber, which will bring untold suffering to this world.

201076.text: As a follower of the merciful God, I'm so worried and eager to smash the scheme of the wicked ones as soon as possible.

201077.text: Oh, so you must have met those sneaky fiends. They're good at worming their way into people's trust to their own nefarious ends.

201078.text: Their target is to grab the Sacred Relic in the tower to revive the demon.

201081.text: It's carved with an oracle, a trial given to us by the merciful God.

201082.text: Only by passing the trial can we find the Sacred Relic and foil the fiends' plot once and for all.

201083.text: If you see one of these steles, please keep me informed.

201084.text: Your good deeds will be favored by God.

201085.text: Uh, I have to find the other steles before those treacherous ones get ahead of me.

201086.text: You should be cautious too. Don't be fooled by them.

201087.text: Here we meet again. You look worried.

201088.text: So, the statements from the preacher of The Church and the ones from the nobles do not match up...

201089.text: There is nothing that exists in absolute.

201090.text: Within kindness there's evil, and within evil there's kindness. Darkness may hide deep inside light, and in the heart of darkness lies light.

201091.text: Life, life, life, life; life is death. Death, death, death, death; death is life.

201092.text: Meow, It's up to how you comprehend it. All behaviors and words embed purposes.

201093.text: Meow? Even you believe that is the treasure?

201094.text: So troublesome. Meow is going back to sleep...

201095.text: The Hall of Reversal is right above us. That's where the Endpoint of the Intangible Radius is.

201096.text: Meow, I saw some other humans passing through. You should be careful. Don't trust others too easily.

201097.text: I'm going back to sleep. Goodbye...

201098.text: Heretic, you wish to renew the strength of the demon?

201099.text: That's very dangerous. As the preacher of The Church, I cannot allow that to happen!

201100.text: Humph, the Church also gets involved? You just want to keep the Dark Magic for yourselves, don't you!

201101.text: We are the followers of the merciful god. Anything we do is instructed by the revelation of god.

201102.text: Stupid fool, don't get in the way of my research.

201103.text: Ugh, that wicked magic is so powerful!

201104.text: It's you. You are still here?

201105.text: You ignorant fool, how dare you talk to me like that.

201106.text: Huh? How naive. You think those chaps from the Church are well-intentioned?

201107.text: Don't expect me to thank you. I never asked you to save me.

201108.text: Ignorance is also a sin. You can die here along with this hypocritical preacher!

201110.text: I have already mastered the Dark Magic! How come I...

201112.text: I haven't done enough research. It seems like I'll have to...

201113.text: I have failed this time. Wicked preacher, you get to keep your life for now.

201114.text: As a talented alchemist, I shall keep this humiliation in mind and get my revenge later.

201115.text: Lord Fellagood, you've been severely hurt. You need to be treated right away.

201117.text: Don't go too far, and once you have more information, do notify me!

201118.text: May the merciful god bless you.

201119.text: So, as you have seen, Snegurochka is collapsing, not far away from its destruction.

201120.text: Yes, all the choices finally lead to the collapse of Snegurochka.

201121.text: Don't blame yourself, because you know little about this world.

201122.text: The destruction of Snegurochka is the inevitable end of the Intangible.

201123.text: Fate will not change even if you fail to defeat Cersivey.

201124.text: But since your ability of Intangible Shifting has awoken, it may be possible for you to rewrite fate.

201125.text: I can help you to channel your Time Shifting magic, which will allow you to go back to a previous point in time.

201126.text: That way, you can understand Snegurochka better, and maybe find a way to save it.

201128.text: You can resonate with me by using the power hidden inside, and gain a little insight into what's going to happen on that day.

201129.text: Although, on how to interpret the patterns that appear, you may just listen to your heart.

201130.text: To restore your memory, go find all the shards.

201131.text: Master, have you forgotten who you are?

201132.text: They also cooperate with those corrupted nobles to amass power from the mortal world.

201133.text: Have you found a way out of this tower?

201134.text: My employer is in the tower and stuck too. Both of us are looking for a way out of this tower.

201135.text: Unlike me, she's noble and civilized. You two will surely become good friends if you ever get a chance to meet with each other.

201136.text: Anyway, be careful of those from the Church. More than likely, they are also here for the treasure.

201137.text: Anyway, be careful of those from the Church. More than likely, they are also here for the treasure.

201139.text: You still carry the great responsibility of bringing back your family's glory days. Do you want to die here?

201140.text: Don't worry. I won't die before I've learned the lost magic.

201141.text: After I get out of this, I'll find you at the tower bottom.

201144.text: Young lady, you are impressive. Bit by bit, I'll let you be my captive.

201147.text: It seems like you crave to dive into the abyss of the forbidden arts just as I do.

201148.text: You will join us one day. Before that, just keep struggling...

201151.text: This is Snegurochka, but not the same chronospace that you were in before.

201152.text: After the Intangible Shifting, you have returned to a time in the past.

201153.text: Can you see the magic boundary over there?

201154.text: That was set by Cersivey to stop others from entering. You are inside the boundary because of the disturbance of chronospace.

201155.text: The mystery of this world is hidden right here, which is the answer you are looking for.

201158.text: You should believe what I've said by now. After the Intangible Shifting, you have returned to a time in the past.

201159.text: But no one can predict what's going to happen next since the chronospace itself has changed.

201160.text: I can't answer that question unfortunately. But I hope you can find the answers to all your questions this time.

201161.text: I have said too much. I'm tired and I'm going back to sleep now.

201162.text: The geothermal surge is really troublesome.

201163.text: Her Saintess asked me to seal all the crevices, but it's so hard!

201164.text: Geothermal activities have become increasingly frequent. Uh, so much trouble. I'm so tired.

201165.text: Hervoraltar, are you slacking off again?

201166.text: Oh, Your Saintess, when have I ever slacked off?

201167.text: You must know what a laborious job it is to seal all these crevices one by one.

201169.text: Please don't be unhappy, Your Saintess.

201170.text: I will stop whining. The cracks here are all sealed. Let's head to the next spot now!

201171.text: Hervoraltar, the geothermal activities are getting more and more active.

201172.text: I can sense that it will bring great disasters to my beloved Snegurochka.

201173.text: It has been over two hundred years since the last time geothermal activity was this frequent.

201174.text: My honorable Saintess, don't worry. You have not only me, but also your followers from the Chivalric Order to share your burden.

201175.text: Let's head to the next spot now.

201177.text: I know everyone from the village, and you don't look familiar at all. You are not from the village, are you?

201178.text: Walking in this blizzard is way too dangerous.

201179.text: I can take you to the village by the foothills. People would love to help you even if you're not a villager.

201180.text: The White Bear? How did you know about that vicious fiend?

201181.text: Investigating? I don't know what you want to know, but you should give up this unrealistic idea!

201182.text: It attacks whoever enters the woods for no reason. Several of my men have already met with misfortune.

201183.text: It's a beast that we are talking about!

201184.text: It's very dangerous ahead. Let's head back to the village now.

201185.text: We are almost running out of food. What should we do...

201187.text: How strange this is! This place seems to have been set up with magic. There must be something hidden inside.

201188.text: Maybe we can find the secret of the blizzard.

201189.text: But how can we get in?

201190.text: Stop there. You don't appear to be someone from the village.

201191.text: Are you a henchman of the Fallen God?

201194.text: Stop there! Don't get any closer!

201195.text: One step closer and I shall release my arrow!

201196.text: I said stop there! Tell us, do you work for the Fallen God?

201197.text: We will never yield to the Fallen God!

201200.text: Human brat! How dare you try to pass through the boundary!

201202.text: Is this the bear that the elders in the village talked about...

201204.text: Are you the pet of the Fallen God?

201205.text: The terrible one who attacked everyone climbing up the mountain!

201206.text: How brazen, and how dare you insult the prestigious Her Saintess!

201207.text: You need to be taught a lesson to have a taste of what fear really is!

201208.text: Those who try to pass through the boundary will be slain. Arrogant humans, prepare to die!

201209.text: Humans are only good at bragging!

201211.text: How did you know my name?

201212.text: You don't look like the guys of the Chivalric Order. Human brat, who are you?

201213.text: Whoever you are, anyone who crosses the boundary shall die!

201214.text: Ugh, I've used too much strength before this.

201216.text: How did you walk into the boundary?

201217.text: Hervoraltar will never answer questions from a human.

201218.text: Human...it looks like you know quite a lot. But no one can disobey the will of Her Saintess.

201219.text: For this world, for this world, Her Saintess has...

201220.text: Human, go to the boundary on the hillside.

201221.text: Her Saintess is over there. If you have questions, just ask Her Saintess yourself.

201222.text: I saw something familiar in your eyes...

201223.text: I was once full of doubts about my own choices...

201224.text: Never mind, I've said too much.

201225.text: Human, go find Her Saintess, if you have the nerve.

201226.text: Thank you for saving me. I'm sorry to have misunderstood you.

201227.text: My father is the leader of the hunters in the village. Everyone calls him Silverbow.

201229.text: My father has been leading the villagers to survive in this frozen world.

201230.text: Like the others in the village, he just took it for granted that this blizzard is a natural disaster and has accepted it as a fact of life.

201231.text: He and the villagers have been fighting against the old hunters as well as the beasts in the mountain, but never thought about changing this harsh environment to address the issue once and for all.

201233.text: Yes, I disagree with my father. I've been doubting the authenticity of these legends.

201234.text: If the legends are true, then maybe the Fallen God has created the blizzard.

201235.text: And if there's a way to defeat the Fallen God, maybe the blizzard will stop.

201236.text: I could faintly sense magic since I was young. Recently the magic here has been growing stronger.

201237.text: Then I started my investigation and found the boundary here.

201238.text: Should I tell her about the greater disaster if the blizzard stops?

201239.text: What's wrong? You seem to know something. Is it the way to stop the blizzard?

201240.text: Just now, that giant bear also said that you seemed to know something. The Fallen God is the cause of everything, right?

201241.text: Oh, you know how to pass through the boundary?

201242.text: The hunting grounds in the foothills are right across the tundra. I can feel the magic is the strongest over there. Maybe that is where the entrance lies.

201244.text: Just now, that giant bear also mentioned that. It's the Fallen God that is the cause of everything!

201245.text: That looks like an ancient magic device. It can launch spherical magic bullets after imbued with magic.

201246.text: But I don't know what to aim at. Maybe something nearby?

201247.text: Hey, is this the entrance? Great! We finally found it!

201249.text: What are you waiting for, come!

201250.text: It's a fork road. What now? Which way should we go?

201251.text: That's what I thought. Let's split up.

201252.text: Let's meet here again after the investigation!

201253.text: Well, I'll go that way then. See you later!

201254.text: Darn it. Where did these guys come from? I've never seen them before...

201256.text: They are really nasty to deal with. Haha, my friend, you have helped me once again.

201257.text: What are you holding in your hand? Did those monsters drop it?

201258.text: I'm not sure. I've been following this path since we separated.

201259.text: I didn't expect to encounter those monsters. They directly attacked me without saying a word.

201260.text: Thank goodness that you showed up just in time!

201262.text: From what I can remember, this mountain has been covered in snow and ice forever. There's nothing but coldness.

201264.text: I wonder where the hot steams come from. If only the villagers could use them to keep warm!

201265.text: Looks like there's nothing else to be investigated nearby. Not too fruitful in my opinion.

201266.text: What's wrong? What are you thinking about?

201267.text: Let's get out of the boundary now. We may encounter those dangerous creatures again!

201268.text: Whew, we are finally out of there. Even though we didn't find out much, I still want to report everything we've seen to my father.

201269.text: Why don't you go back to the village with me to have a rest?

201270.text: It's about what that giant bear said, right? Alright, see you then.

201271.text: The blizzard on the mountain is getting heavier. Be careful out there!

201272.text: Little thing, how dare you mess with the traps we set up carefully. You cannot get away with this.

201274.text: This is what we shall do. Let's break one of its legs so that it can no longer...

201275.text: Who are you? How dare you tell the Chivalric Order what to do?

201276.text: Mind your own business. Kids should just stay away from adults' affairs!

201278.text: Looks like you are no ordinary human. Since you have drawn your wand towards the Chivalric Order, you have shown great disrespect to Her Saintess!

201281.text: It's you, that little nosy chump again! Why are you always in my way!

201282.text: Forget it. I'm no match for you.

201283.text: Remember to go to the boundary on the hillside. Her Saintess is over there...

201284.text: Thank you for saving me. I can't believe that monster is afraid of you!

201287.text: Urgh, I can't waste more time here. I still need to set up traps in the tundra outside the village.

201288.text: I'll definitely teach those old geezers a lesson this time.

201289.text: I've still got things to do. See you around.

201290.text: You are not going to stop him?

201291.text: You are completely different this time, meow.

201292.text: Seems you have also realized that some things are inevitable.

201294.text: Since you have decided to end the chaos in this world, then you should further dig out the truth about this world.

201295.text: You are a brave child too.

201296.text: Oh, you are here. Where have you been? We were all worried about you.

201297.text: Thank you for your kindness. You are really different from the other humans.

201298.text: There is indeed a magic trap of some sort nearby.

201299.text: Just walk across this place and you'll see a strange ice sculpture at the end of the tundra.

201300.text: There seems to be an invisible wall by the sculpture, blocking everyone out. Maybe that's where you want to take a look.

201301.text: I never thought a human would thank me one day. Actually I should be the one feeling grateful.

201302.text: The blizzard is getting heavier on the tundra. Please be careful!

201305.text: There's nothing we could do really. I came here in search of the stored food I hid here before.

201306.text: If I can find the food, we don't have to take the risk to steal from the village anymore.

201307.text: That's right. There used to be plenty of food here. So we lived here before and have hidden some food under the snow somewhere.

201308.text: It's just that the wolf pack will attack us on sight. I...I dare not to go searching.

201309.text: The food is sufficient for us to migrate again to another place.

201310.text: I promise not to steal from the villagers again.

201311.text: Oh, this is the food we stored before.

201312.text: Howl...Thank you! The food is sufficient for us to migrate again.

201315.text: Cersivey looks me up and down.

201316.text: Her face suddenly clouded over as if something struck her...

201317.text: Despicable! Sneaked up on me when I was working on the magic circle...

201318.text: Never...I will never allow you to put this world into chaos again!

201319.text: You want to insult me? Is that your revenge?

201321.text: Lord Cersivey, you have misunderstood her intention.

201323.text: We have met before during the War of Protectors.

201324.text: You have the wrong person. Please look closer. She's not Lord Ereshkigal.

201325.text: Those eyes...Yes, I will never forget the arrogance in her eyes.

201326.text: Well then, you must have broken into the boundary with a certain purpose. You are allowed to report now.

201327.text: (Sigh) Aren't you the one who's truly arrogant...

201328.text: (With a surprised expression) Why do you ask?

201329.text: So, you have also witnessed the end of this world?

201330.text: Are you trying to fix this world to seek atonement?

201331.text: If you are aware of all these things, you must have seen the end of this world.

201332.text: As for the Time Shifting ability, I've seen it before.

201333.text: It just never occurred to me that someone else also possesses that ability.

201334.text: You can see that the geothermy here has been escalating. I can predict that the burst of lava will eventually destroy this world.

201335.text: Only by summoning a blizzard to cover this land with ice and snow can the geothermal surge be suppressed.

201336.text: (Sigh) I've also done some investigation, but I didn't find out the cause of the Geothermy.

201337.text: Geothermal activities have been more active recently. All I can do is to make the blizzard heavier.

201338.text: Meow, that must be the boundary set by Lord Cersivey...and the memory of all seems to have been erased as well.

201339.text: Meow, I think that was to protect the dignity of the Protector.

201341.text: This is my world. I don't need any outsider to help me. You will just ruin it.

201342.text: Get out of the boundary and leave this world, now!

201343.text: Proud as always...Meow, all this talking has made me tired.

201344.text: With the crackling sound of the sticks, the fire erupted instantly.

201345.text: What are you talking about? There's a hidden boundary on the mountain top?

201346.text: Then the rumors seem to be true. Someone is brewing a plot.

201347.text: Father, you also heard of that?

201348.text: I just have a faint hunch that the conflict between the old hunters and us is not as simple as that.

201349.text: Even though my young wards have been going on about taking revenge on the old hunters, those men are really not that despicable.

201350.text: I've always had this feeling that there might be someone hiding behind who has been inciting all these conflicts.

201351.text: If there's a boundary, maybe the ones who created the conflicts for us are hiding right inside.

201352.text: Oh, the one I met outside the village...

201354.text: I met her outside the village, where I suggested her not to linger in the snowmountain.

201355.text: Just as I suspected...someone has been plotting against us in secret this whole time. Those despicable guys are unforgivable!

201356.text: They are instructed by the Fallen God, aren't they?

201357.text: Darn it. I'm going back to round up some young men to head to the mountain top together!

201358.text: Don't try to stop me. I will make them pay!

201359.text: Father! Let her finish what she's saying.

201362.text: The blizzard was created to protect us?

201365.text: That's not the only reason. I saw the steaming crevices myself too.

201366.text: Alright, I believe you then. Is there anything I can do for you?

201367.text: Oh...The child has lost her entire family...

201369.text: Don't be afraid. Come with us to our village and it will be your new home.

201370.text: Don't worry. I'll take her back to the village.

201371.text: I do hope the blizzard could stop, but if at the expense of destroying this world...

201374.text: We are going back to the village. Do be careful!

201375.text: Oh right. I grabbed some warm clothes from the old hunters. Should keep you warm. Take this!

201377.text: Ugh, what kind of monsters are these?!

201378.text: Did you forget Her Saintess's order?

201379.text: We gotta seal the cracks in all places no matter what.

201380.text: I know, but where did these monsters come from?

201382.text: Your Great Saintess, I have failed to complete the mission you entrusted me with...

201384.text: How dare you ask us, Her Saintess's guards, to retreat!

201385.text: You are going to help us?

201386.text: We will never retreat. Have a glimpse of our willpower!

201390.text: We are here to seal the crevices in this place under the order of Her Saintess.

201391.text: Yet, just after sealing several of those cracks, we found ourselves besieged by those monsters.

201392.text: It was like they were trying to stop us.

201393.text: No, we have set up our camps not far from here.

201394.text: This place is full of crevices, so our captain ordered us to station here.

201396.text: If our captain is also on the mission, they will encounter those monsters too!

201397.text: You're right! We'd better hurry back to the camp site to support them!

201398.text: Sorry, we have to rush back now. See you around!

201400.text: No need to worry about me. I can still fight. Those monsters though...

201401.text: We encountered some of those just now. It seems like they are trying to stop us from sealing the cracks.

201403.text: Her Saintess has entrusted me with this mission of glory. I must complete it.

201405.text: Captain, you should find a way out of here first. Leave this place to us. We'll take care of things.

201409.text: No wonder Lord Hervoraltar lost to you. The power you possess is truly unbelievable.

201410.text: Young witch, thank you for your help.

201412.text: You have all made a great sacrifice. Take the injured to the castle where they can rest and recover.

201414.text: The Ice Crust? Could it be...

201415.text: That was a long time ago, back to when there was no threat of geothermy. Things were all vibrant here.

201416.text: As the Protector, I run this world.

201417.text: Yet, one day, flames intruded this world.

201418.text: You heard me right. Those monsters wield Flame Magic. The abundance of them damaged this world recklessly with fire.

201419.text: They wanted nothing but to destroy. There's no way to communicate with them.

201420.text: The ancestors of the wolves and the humans here fought them bravely alongside my warriors. Many lives were lost.

201421.text: In the end, I sealed the rest of them with my Freezing Magic and buried them underground.

201422.text: After I summoned the blizzard, I erased everyone's memory. No one remembers the battles against those monsters anymore.

201423.text: The Ice Crust you saw on the monsters is most likely the result of my Freezing Magic.

201424.text: But since they have been sealed by my magic, they shouldn't stand a chance of waking up again...

201425.text: Those monsters cannot think for themselves. All they have is the instinct to ruin everything with flames.

201426.text: If they ever woke up again, they would show themselves in no time, which would mean total destruction for this world.

201427.text: That's impossible. Geothermy has been going on for hundreds of years. If the Geothermy was created by them, they would have already rushed out trying to tear this world apart.

201428.text: I'll fully investigate everything. No one is allowed to destroy this world.

201429.text: I'll protect this world no matter what.

201430.text: Young witch, do not get mixed up in this. Go back to where you belong.

201431.text: You remind me of that abomination every time I see you.

201432.text: Maybe the answer to the mystery is at the place where those monsters appeared.

201433.text: When did those monsters start to show up?

201435.text: So, where can I find those monsters?

201436.text: No, that shouldn't be what they aim at.

201438.text: Let's think about it more carefully.

201439.text: That can't be right. There have never been monsters in that place, and they have no reason to go there.

201440.text: Wait, maybe the monsters can be found in places full of crevices.

201441.text: But the cracks nearby have all been sealed already. Where can I find another place like this?

201442.text: Right, I remember there were huge crevices in the Saintess Square, where runny lava erupted. Maybe I can solve the mystery there.

201443.text: That's strange. Those guys from the Glorious Silverbow stopped their provocations!

201444.text: Hey! Don't come any closer. Go back to your village!

201445.text: I won't buy that just because you said so.

201446.text: Our grudge with the Silverbow is too deep to be solved merely by words alone.

201448.text: Did Silverbow send you here to trick me? Are you trying to clear my suspicion with this?

201449.text: I don't trust the words of others. I only believe what I see myself.

201450.text: Go back. I'll go seek the truth with my own eyes.

201452.text: I grabbed it from that young fellow.

201453.text: I met him on the Frozen Lake Surface just now.

201454.text: He didn't strike back. How strange.

201456.text: I have heard about what happened from Lord Silverbow. He asked me to dismantle the traps here. These traps were prepared for the old guys.

201457.text: Oh! This is my precious bow. That old geezer grabbed it from me. Did you help me retrieve it?

201459.text: Erm...It's too complicated for me. I'm not that clever.

201460.text: Both Lord Silverbow and you say there's a misunderstanding. So I've chosen to believe you.

201461.text: People like me, who only know how to brawl and hunt, can make the conflict more complicated.

201462.text: So, I'd better say nothing and let him take my bow.

201463.text: Haha. Don't worry. Even without the bow, I can still hunt with my fists.

201464.text: Ah, you are the witch from earlier.

201466.text: Well, there are huge crevices in the Saintess Square, but everyone's so busy tending the injured that none of us has the time to seal them.

201467.text: That would be wonderful! The square is located deep in the castle.

201469.text: The captain at the gate has already briefed us on everything.

201470.text: Will the world be devoured by the Geothermal Surge?

201471.text: Nonsense. I'll not believe it without seeing it.

201473.text: Fear not, child. I will never let go!

201474.text: You old geezer, why are you...

201475.text: My body just moved on its own! Oh hell, I can't hold on any longer!

201478.text: I told you that I didn't mean to help. My body just moved on its own.

201484.text: Did she just come out of nowhere and assault us? What a dangerous one!

201486.text: Oh hell! Get ready for it!

201488.text: This is Cetess, the vice captain of the Chivalric Order.

201489.text: A few months ago, I sent her to scout the crevices that recently appeared in the foothills, but she never returned.

201490.text: She is not the true perpetrator of the Geothermy. Seems like someone else is manipulating her.

201491.text: Yes. Someone who can wield powerful mind magic is holding sway over her.

201494.text: Cetess, my loyal knight. Seems like you have restored your consciousness.

201497.text: All I can remember is the ground cracked open, and then I fell into the abyss.

201498.text: Down there, a bunch of Lava Monsters attacked me. Then...then...

201500.text: Don't push yourself so hard. You are quite weak right now. Go back to the Chivalric Order and get some rest.

201501.text: It seems the real culprit is lurking underground.

201502.text: This feeling...The source of the Geothermy should be down there.

201504.text: Do you feel that too? Magic power has been accumulating ahead, which must be the real cause behind Snegurochka's demolition.

201505.text: We've returned, and this time...things will be different.

201506.text: It seems, this time, we can change the fate of Snegurochka and save it from total destruction.

201507.text: Go and fix Snegurochka. Save it from destruction.

201509.text: Looks like my children have taken good care of you.

201510.text: I am Sinmara the Inferno, serving the great Lord Ereshkigal.

201511.text: Just as I expected, a jackal of that abhorrent witch.

201512.text: Cersivey, all you've left to offer is your empty talk.

201513.text: My master suffered from enough humiliations in the War of Protectors. And here I am to take revenge for her and destroy all of you completely.

201514.text: Are those disgusting monsters your henchmen?

201515.text: Watch your tongue. These adorable kids are my gifts to you all.

201517.text: Yup. They can only live in a world of lava and fire.

201518.text: Therefore, they will destroy everything in their sight with fire, making an environment suitable for them to reproduce. Just like what you see right now.

201520.text: They were sealed by you with Freezing Magic, but still point a way for me to the Geothermy here.

201521.text: You must have also felt it, this splendid temperature...

201523.text: You Protectors are indeed powerful. It cost an enormous amount of magic and took me quite some time to gradually unseal them.

201524.text: It's impossible to defeat the Protector of this world just on my own, therefore, I need these kids. I need them all to be awakened.

201525.text: Also, to curb the surging Geothermy, you have set a gigantic magic circle to bring the blizzard, which has consumed most of your magic, hasn't it?

201526.text: Now, my children have all awoken. Soon, very soon, this world will burn in hell's flames.

201528.text: It seems we have more guests here.

201530.text: Ah, I've done all of these wholeheartedly, only for the sake of you.

201531.text: My heart was ripped apart upon seeing you sealed.

201532.text: But now you are finally back...

201533.text: Ah, have you any idea how anxiously I've been waiting for this day?

201534.text: Alas, looks like it's just an empty puppet.

201535.text: Indeed. How stupid I am. You are still being tortured in the dark Abyss.

201536.text: It must be those reprehensible Protectors behind this farce of puppet.

201537.text: This is a humiliation to the noble and beautiful you. I shall let this puppet pay for this sin.

201538.text: Ah, the cursed Protectors. They not only sealed you, but also humiliated you with this abomination.

201540.text: Imbecile. You think you can defeat me so easily?

201541.text: This is my true form, slumbering in the magic core. You can't defeat me by just shattering the vessel!

201545.text: No, the Geothermy is going ballistic. If this goes on, my world will...

201547.text: My master, you were in great danger and triggered the ability of Time Shifting.

201548.text: It can take a tremendous toll on your body, so please don't push yourself too hard.

201549.text: That was a close one. Were it not for the Intangible Shifting, you would have surely died in the magma burst.

201550.text: You have returned to a time in the past...This is Snegurochka before its devastation.

201551.text: The Snegurochka before the Intangible Shifting has been destroyed. Lava devoured the entire world.

201552.text: Maybe the Frost of Absolute Zero can neutralize her great explosion.

201553.text: This delicate magical item is made of ice and never melts. It's said that it can suppress any heat or explosion.

201554.text: Seeing the hidden flowing of magic will help you perceive the true nature of things.

201555.text: Ah! You mean the barrier made of ice!

201556.text: That's a masterpiece of La Crima.

201557.text: So you have obtained the Eternal Ice from the Saintess?

201558.text: Luckily, I happen to have an Ice Cryolite.

201559.text: Please allow me to take you to La Crima.

201560.text: Only she's in possession of the rare Tear of Magic.

201561.text: She's in the front of the castle. But she doesn't like to be bothered by others and has blocked the way with her Gem Magic.

201562.text: Still lack the materials for the Invisible Mirror. It's impossible to stop Sinmara without it.

201563.text: Search in the castle again but be more careful this time.

201568.text: Why? Why do you come to me?

201570.text: Despicable Witch...A filthy being like you cannot exist in this world!

201571.text: Welcome to the Shop. Please enjoy your shopping here.

201572.text: Please feel free to shop here.

201573.text: Are there monsters on both the east and west sides?

201574.text: Don't worry. I'll protect the village. Go hide yourselves.

201575.text: It seems that only by eliminating all the monsters in the tower can safety and peace be brought back to the village.

201576.text: I'll repel the monsters in the west. As for the east, over to you.

201577.text: Even your world is under threat because of Irminsul's chaos?

201578.text: All of these are merely speculations. If only we could find more evidence.

201579.text: May the wind always be at your back. Best of luck.

201581.text: Why did you know the secret of the Chronospace?

201582.text: Nevertheless, what you have done is nothing but an act of pure selfishness. You persecuted my people in favor of your world.

201583.text: Though their ending remains the same, my people should sacrifice for me. All is to prevent Irminsul from falling apart.

201584.text: Ribbit...ribbit. Thanks for your help. I shall go on fulfilling my mission.

201585.text: Until our paths cross again. And may your soul be redeemed too!

201586.text: That's why you entered the tower? To exterminate those monsters?

201587.text: Do you remember a village around the tower? There are only woods around here.

201588.text: Only a few monsters have escaped from the tower so far. The chaos of other worlds just started to erode this world.

201589.text: Perhaps your deep slumber has affected your memory.

201591.text: The west and east sides of the village are again infested with monsters rushing out of the tower!

201592.text: Hey, you have returned. Thanks for your help last time. I just found the legend of the treasure has attracted more people to come here.

201593.text: Yes. My fellows and I saw someone mysterious while exploring the tower.

201594.text: Seems to be an alchemist. Very suspicious.

201595.text: Keep your eyes peeled. And hopefully next time we meet, you can tell me more information about the treasure.

201601.text: Finally...finally I have completely sealed the Geothermy.

201602.text: No need for that anymore. All is over.

201603.text: The long cold night has passed...

201607.text: Young witch, you have distinguished yourself from that woe-bringer. You have truly saved this world.

201608.text: It seems that there are other missions waiting for you.

201609.text: Let's part from here. My world is in ruins. I shall restore it to its former glory.
